p: The business-as-usual land-use change scenario produced a 17% population decline, whereas the compact growth scenario (similar to smart-growth, in which increased development in urban centers is emphasized rather than sprawl outside of existing cities) produced a 15% population decline ( Fig 3). As expected, most of this change is around the perimeter of cities and other development. This loss of habitat along the eastern edge of the Central Valley, and at the southern tip of the valley, results in patchier habitat in these regions.
